business.headline: New labour codes: Will variable pay change your salary, PF and gratuity?Will your take-home salary change under the new labour codes, and what will higher variable pay mean for your PF and gratuity in the long run? Let's understand.

Goa fire tragedy: From compensation to insurance, what victims can claimThe Uphaar cinema fire in Delhi, the Kumbakonam school blaze, the Mumbai Kamala Mills fire, the Surat coaching centre tragedy, each incident left behind not just casualties, but families pushed into years of legal battles simply to secure basic compensation.

Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $40 million to 2 women in talc powder caseThe verdict comes as the company faces tens of thousands of similar lawsuits nationwide and after its latest attempt to resolve the litigation through bankruptcy was rejected by US courts.

How is young India really spending money? Hint: It's not gadgets and clothesYoung Indians' spending habits are shifting quickly, and it's no longer about gadgets or new outfits. Here's a closer look at where their money is actually going.

Cabinet clears 100% FDI in insurance: What the new bill means for the sectorThe government says the changes are designed to offer stronger protection to policyholders and bring more players into the market. This could lead to better products, faster claim settlements, and improved customer service.

Aroon Purie rings NSE bell, says it's for next chapter of India, India Today GroupIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie on Friday rang the closing bell at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) to mark the Group's 50-year journey and said it was for the next chapter of India and the India Today Group.

NSE bell we ring today is for next chapter of India, India Today Group: Aroon PurieThe moment symbolised both a milestone for the media group and a nod to India's financial markets, which have grown alongside the Group's own evolution since 1975.

Video: NSE felicitates India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie on 50-year milestoneNational Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Ashish Kumar Chauhan on Friday felicitated India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie as the Group completed 50 years at a ceremony in Mumbai.

Retail inflation rises to 0.71% in November from 0.25% in OctoberFood inflation remained in deflation for the sixth straight month, but the pace of decline narrowed sharply. The Consumer Food Price Index showed a contraction of 3.91% in November, compared to a much steeper 5.02% fall in October.

Silver prices cross Rs 2 lakh milestone: Is there more upside left?Silver has been on a strong upward streak over the past month, supported by a softer US dollar, falling global interest rates and renewed buying in industrial commodities.
Video: India Today Chairman Aroon Purie rings NSE bell to mark ITG's 50 yearsIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie rang the NSE bell on Friday to mark the Group's 50 years.
Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%

India–US trade deal talks move forward, but Delhi refuses to open agriculture marketIndia has refused to allow American agricultural products into the Indian market. India believes that permitting US farm goods would increase competitive pressure on domestic farmers and reduce their income.

Unclaimed wealth is rising in India. How silence around money is costing familiesA growing number of Indian families are learning that wealth without communication can turn into confusion, conflict and costly mistakes. The solution begins long before any will is written.

From TDS gaps to bank errors: Why your ITR refund is delayed and what to do nowSeveral taxpayers in India have not received their income tax refunds for the assessment year 2025-26, with delays attributed to verification errors and compliance checks.

Inside the world of India's ultra-rich: What they buy, how they liveHow are India's wealthiest families redefining luxury today, and what do their latest spending habits reveal about their lifestyles? Let's have a look.

Keys to new homes first, then redevelopment begins: Pranav Adani on Dharavi planPranav Adani said that the Dharavi project is finally progressing with a concrete plan to build around 2 lakh new homes, ensuring residents are moved into these units before any demolition or redevelopment of old structures begins.

NPS expands investment options: Now gold, silver ETFs and Nifty 250 picks allowedIndia's pension regulator issues updated unified investment rules for pension schemes, introducing clearer limits and a wider range of asset classes.

New labour codes: No, your take-home salary isn't reducing. Here's the mathFears of reduced take-home salaries have surged since the new labour codes were notified, but a closer look at the PF calculation shows the impact may not be what many employees expect.

Hindustan Zinc share price jumps over 3%: Why is the stock rising today?Hindustan Zinc's share price advanced over 3% in Friday trading, continuing its upward momentum amid rising silver prices and sector-wide gains in metals stocks.

entertainment.headline: Bait Switch: Dhurandhar's Rehman Dakait and Raj Kapoor's Satyam Shivam Sundaram Dhurandhar draws viewers with its anti-Pakistan spy thriller plot, yet Akshaye Khanna's Rehman Dakait gains massive social media buzz via his FA9LA entry. It echoes Raj Kapoor's Satyam Shivam Sundaram strategy, but inverted unintentionally

Dhurandhar box office: Ranveer Singh's film races towards Rs 300 crore milestone Aditya Dhar's period spy thriller Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh, nears Rs 300 crore at the Indian box office following a strong performance and notable weekend growth. The film has become Singh's second highest-grossing film to date.

The End Of an Era review: An emotional and intimate love letter to SwiftiesRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025 The End Of an Era docuseries offers an intimate backstage glimpse into Taylor Swift's Eras tour. It moves past fandom to reveal vulnerability and care, making it a heartfelt reflection on the tour's cultural impact.

Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu: Chiranjeevi locks Sankranthi release for his next The action-comedy film Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu starring Chiranjeevi is set for a Sankranthi release. The film also stars Nayanthara as the female opposite.

Arjun Rampal announces engagement to longtime partner Gabriella Demetriades Actor Arjun Rampal has announced engagement to his longtime partner and fashion designer Gabriella Demetriades. The couple opened up about the new phase of their relationship on Rhea Chakraborty's podcast.

Dhurandhar is rare as it views India's terror issue from Pak side of the border Dhurandhar bases its story in Pakistan to dissect terror attacks in India, which makes it unique. The film traces the trail of the 26/11 carnage from Lyari to Mumbai.

Soha Ali Khan reviews Kunal Khemu's Single Papa, says it made her heart full Soha Ali Khan has reviewed the comedy series Single Papa, which features her actor-husband Kunal Khemu. She praised the show for its light-hearted and emotional moments.

Kareena Kapoor calls Daayra director Meghna Gulzar tigress in special birthday note As Director Meghna Gulzar celebrated her 52nd birthday, Kareena Kapoor shared an emotional social media tribute from the sets of 'Daayra'. Kapoor called the film one of her most special projects, praising the director as kind, passionate, and sharp, and expressing gratitude for her mentorship.

Hema Malini honours Dharmendra's evergreen appeal in special video tribute Actor-politician Hema Malini honoured the legacy of her late husband, Dharmendra, with a special collage video of his films and family moments, created for prayer meetings in Delhi and Mathura. The tribute highlighted his "evergreen appeal" and included high praise from the late actor Dilip Kumar.

Mukesh Chhabra debated over Akshaye Khanna, Arjun Rampal's casting in Dhurandhar Casting director Mukesh Chhabra attributes the success of the film 'Dhurandhar' to his surprising cast choices, explaining he wanted to "twist things" for the audience. Chhabra revealed he and the director spent hours intensely debating the suitability of Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal, and R Madhavan.

Raj Babbar remembers Smita Patil on 39th death anniversary: Gave us so little time Actor-politician Raj Babbar shared a deeply emotional tribute on the 39th death anniversary of his late wife, Smita Patil. He praised her profound empathy, calling her quality of being "extraordinarily good" both on screen and off screen the key to her greatness as an actor.

Randeep Hooda compares witch-hunt against Dhurandhar, to Swatantrya Veer Savarkar Actor Randeep Hooda reviewed for the Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar', declaring he was "completely amazed." He strongly defended the film against its "witch-hunt," comparing the intense scrutiny to the challenges his own movie, 'Swatantrya Veer Savarkar', faced.

Timothee Chalamet on ignoring Dave Bautista at Oscars: Was looking for my mom Actor Timothée Chalamet apologised to Dave Bautista for seemingly ignoring him at the Oscars, clarifying that he was franticly looking for his mother at the time. Speaking on Cody Rhodes' channel, Chalamet expressed concern that Bautista might think he was trying to "Hollywood" him.

Samantha-Raj Nidimoru make first public appearance after Coimbatore wedding After their intimate wedding in Coimbatore earlier this month, Samantha and Raj Nidimoru were spotted together for the first time at the Hyderabad airport. A video of the couple walking towards the terminal has since surfaced online.

Aanand L Rai admits he failed to utilise Shah Rukh Khan's stardom in Zero Director Aanand L Rai addressed the commercial underperformance of his 2018 film 'Zero', citing challenges in integrating Shah Rukh Khan's established persona with the character as written.

Hailee Steinfeld, husband Josh Allen announce first pregnancy with adorable post Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen are expecting their first child, with the couple sharing the news through a video and reflecting on the recent milestones of their relationship, including their wedding and adjusting to life together.
Dhurandhar is Lyari Town ka Satya Dhurandhar humanises Lyari gangsters so thoroughly that you catch yourself rooting for the rogues. Much like Satya did for Mumbai's underworld.

Anand Math: A film that traces India's nation-building challenges through Bankim Chandra's vision As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit Anand Math. The cinematic adaptation of Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay's iconic novel strategically inverts colonial narratives while constructing a particular vision of nationalist masculinity, and gives us India's greatest song – Vande Mataram.

Rajinikanth's Padayappa re-release in France theatre sees fan frenzy The re-release of the 1999 cult classic, 'Padayappa', marked Rajinikanth's 75th birthday, turning theatres nationwide into "live concerts." A viral video from a theatre in France captured the global celebration, showing fans dancing and cheering wildly for the actor on the silver screen.

general news.headline: Toxic smog, dense fog choke Delhi-NCR as AQI slips deeper into severe zoneDelhi's air quality has deteriorated sharply, plunging into the hazardous zone amid dense smog and fog. Authorities have invoked Stage-IV emergency measures to combat the severe pollution affecting the capital and NCR region.

Who is R Sreelekha, ex-DGP and BJP's likely maiden mayor in Thiruvananthapuram?Kerala's first woman IPS officer R Sreelekha scored a big win in Thiruvananthapuram, fuelling speculation she could become the BJP's first mayor in the state capital.

India warns of 'appropriate measures' after Mexico hikes import tariffs by 50%India has strongly opposed Mexico's move to raise import tariffs on countries lacking free trade agreements, signalling potential protective actions for its exporters.

VIPs first, fans later: How Messi tour's Kolkata flop exposed misplaced prioritiesLionel Messi's presence could not mask what unfolded in Kolkata. The event laid bare a system where optics mattered more than organisation, and fans paid the price for failures not of their making.

Dial a bar, raise your house-party game. Bartenders for just Rs 2,000Professional bartenders and mixologists are elevating India's house party scene. Bring one in and give your party an instant, caramel-popcorn-level glow-up. Across metros, and even in smaller cities like Jabalpur and Nagpur, you can dial a bar home at just a day's notice. And prices start at just Rs 2,000.

IND vs PAK Live: Mhatre attacks after Suryavanshi departs cheaplyIND vs PAK U-19 Asia Cup Live: Pakistan have won the toss and opted to bowl first against India in Dubai. Vaibhav Suryavanshi has departed cheaply for 5, getting caught and bowled against Mohammad Seyam.

Delhi schools shift Classes 1–9 and 11 to hybrid mode as AQI turns severeThe Delhi Directorate of Education (DDE) has directed all schools to shift Classes 1–9 and 11 to hybrid mode amid worsening air quality. The decision follows the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) activating GRAP-IV measures to control pollution.

Messi lost his cool, was frustrated: First-hand witness recalls Kolkata chaosFormer India midfielder Lalkamal Bhowmick said Messi appeared visibly unsettled during the GOAT Tour event at Kolkata's Vivekananda Yuvabharati Stadium, prompting security to step in and cut short his appearance on Saturday.

Arjun Rampal announces engagement to longtime partner Gabriella DemetriadesActor Arjun Rampal has announced engagement to his longtime partner and fashion designer Gabriella Demetriades. The couple opened up about the new phase of their relationship on Rhea Chakraborty's podcast.

Multiple buses collide due to heavy fog on Haryana highway, several injuredSeveral passengers were injured and taken to nearby hospitals, while police have launched an investigation, citing low visibility as the preliminary cause.

Bhutia slams Messi's Kolkata visit fiasco, says it tarnishes India's imageBhaichung Bhutia has expressed disappointment over the mishandling of Lionel Messi's Kolkata visit at Salt Lake Stadium, highlighting the negative impact on the country's image and urging organizers to prioritize genuine fans in future events.

What's the story with Gautam Gambhir and the omnipresent cricket ball?Have you noticed what's always in coach Gautam Gambhir's frame? The cricket ball. Are we reading too much into a simple habit? Probably. But like everyone else, we can't help interpreting everything Gautam Gambhir does, and doesn't do.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

H-1B, H-4 visas prudentially revoked in US amid interview delays in IndiaAmid the mass rescheduling of H-1B visa interviews in India, many US-based temporary work visa holders have reportedly received emails informing them that their visas have been "prudentially revoked". An immigration expert says many previously cleared issues are being re-reviewed.

Gujarat couple, child trying to migrate to Portugal, held hostage in Libya: ReportA couple from Gujarat's Mehsana district and their three-year-old daughter were allegedly taken hostage in Libya while trying to migrate to Portugal. Kidnappers are demanding a ransom of Rs 2 crore.

Dhurandhar's popularity isn't accidental; it exposes India's mental distressDhurandhar didn't trend this week because of its action sequences. It trended because millions recognised their own unspoken trauma in its shadowy world. In a country where mental-health conversations remain guarded, a violent film has become an accidental national therapy session.

John Cena ends WWE chapter with gritty loss vs Gunther at Saturday's Main EventSaturday Night's Main event: John Cena's legendary WWE career has come to an end as he lost to Gunther via submission on Sunday, December 14.

2 killed, 8 injured in shooting at Brown University, Trump says FBI on sceneAt least two people were killed and eight critically injured in a shooting at Brown University during exams as police searched for a suspect and ordered a campus shelter-in-place Saturday afternoon.

Soha Ali Khan reviews Kunal Khemu's Single Papa, says it made her heart fullSoha Ali Khan has reviewed the comedy series Single Papa, which features her actor-husband Kunal Khemu. She praised the show for its light-hearted and emotional moments.

IND vs SA 3rd T20I: Runs, risks and experiments to continue in cold Dharamshala?India vs South Africa 3rd T20I preview: The experiments within the Indian team is expected to continue as they take on South Africa in chilly Dharamshala on Sunday, December 13. With pressure mounting on Suryakumar and Gill, can India find the right answers to all their questions against an upbeat Proteas side?

Skyroot founder reveals when India's 1st private rocket will launchSkyroot Aerospace prepares Vikram-1 rocket for maiden orbital launch from Sriharikota. India's first private rocket company aims to reach low-Earth orbit within two months.

Rajasthan Royals IPL 2026 auction strategy explained: Five players RR can target IPL 2026 mini auction: With Rs 16.05 crores to work with, the Rajasthan Royals are in dire need of an attacking-minded spin option. With limited options in the auction list, the franchise would be pressured to break the bank for a specialist spinner. In addition, the franchise has kept silent on its captain for the coming season. It would be interesting to see if they pursue any captaincy candidates in the auction.

Messi GOAT tour Mumbai leg Live: Security intensified for Wankhede, CCI events Messi GOAT Tour In India Mumbai live updates: Lionel Messi is expected to arrive in Mumbai shortly after his whirlwind opening day across Kolkata and Hyderabad. His Sunday schedule in Mumbai will center around charity-focused engagements, including two major events — one at the Cricket Club of India and another at the Wankhede Stadium. Security across the city has been heightened to prevent a repeat of the chaotic scenes witnessed in Kolkata.

Kerala roots, spark by 2011 World Cup: Alishan Sharafu's UAE rise and IPL dream Inspired by India's 2011 World Cup heroes, Alishan Sharafu holds on to big dreams with the UAE and has set himself a major goal by making it to the IPL. The Abu Dhabi Knight Riders star talks about his journey, facing India on the international stage and more.

India vs South Africa 3rd T20I preview: The experiments within the Indian team is expected to continue as they take on South Africa in chilly Dharamshala on Sunday, December 13. With pressure mounting on Suryakumar and Gill, can India find the right answers to all their questions against an upbeat Proteas side?

Fan paid Rs 10,000 to see Lionel Messi in Kolkata, ends up stealing carpet insteadA Lionel Messi fan in Kolkata paid Rs 10,000 for a ticket but did not get a glimpse of the football icon as chaos forced the event to end early, leaving behind anger, damage and an unforgettable story.

Lionel Messi's GOAT Tour redeems itself in Hyderabad after Kolkata chaosAfter the chaos in Kolkata, Hyderabad delivered a fan-first Messi experience, with smooth organisation, clear sightlines and genuine player interaction, restoring faith in the GOAT tour.

India our second home, Afghanistan aiming higher in T20 World Cup: Gulbadin NaibAfghanistan veteran Gulbadin Naib says the team will use their "second home" India and IPL experience to push harder for the T20 World Cup 2026 title after their historic 2024 semi-final run.

Lionel Messi in Hyderabad: Football Icon Meets CM Revanth Reddy, Set for Match at Uppal StadiumIn this breaking news report, India Today's Abdul Basheer details Lionel Messi's high-profile visit to Hyderabad. The Argentine legend met Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy at Taj Falaknuma Palace and is scheduled to play a friendly match at Uppal Stadium. The report confirms that Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi will also attend the event. Basheer highlights the heightened security measures following alleged lapses during Messi's Kolkata visit, noting that the Telangana DGP has alerted officers to ensure a smooth event.

Babar Azam in BBL: When and where to watch Pakistan star in tournament openerBBL 2025-26: Babar Azam is set to make his Big Bash League debut for the Sydney Sixers in the 2025–26 season, headlining a strong Pakistani contingent across multiple franchises as the tournament kicks off across Australia.

Who is Satadru Dutta? Messi's GOAT tour organiser who was arrested in KolkataLionel Messi's tour of India got off to a rocky start as the Kolkata leg of the event saw chaos erupt as the Argentina superstar left the Salt Lake stadium early. Here's a look at Satadru Dutta, the main organiser who was arrested after fan outrage in Kolkata.

Tilak Varma not worried about cold Dharamsala weather: Cannot give excusesIND vs SA, 3rd T20I: Tilak Varma said that India won't give any excuses and are up for the challenge of playing in cold conditions in the third game of the series against South Africa on Sunday at the HPCA Stadium.

Tilak Varma backs Gautam Gambhir's T20I methods: Everyone, barring openers, is flexibleIND vs SA: Tilak Varma said India's T20I batting order remains flexible beyond the openers, backing Gautam Gambhir's tactics and Axar Patel's promotion as the team looks to regain the series lead against South Africa in Dharamsala.

Changes not for sake of it: South Africa coach defends constant shuffling in IND T20IsIndia vs South Africa 3rd T20I: South Africa coach Shukri Conrad has defended his side's decision to make constant changes to the lineup during the T20I series against India. The Proteas made three changes to their side during the second T20I.

Why Lionel Messi left Salt Lake stadium quickly: The real reason explainedLionel Messi's one-hour stay at the Salt Lake Stadium in Kolkata was cut short, leading to chaos to ensue inside the venue. Here's a look at the reasons that eventually led to the early exit of the Argentina superstar from the venue.

India vs Pakistan Live Streaming: When and where to watch U19 Men's Asia Cup clashIndia and Pakistan are all set for a blockbuster Group A clash in the U19 Asia Cup 2025 on Sunday after both teams began their campaigns with commanding victories.

Ashes: Usman Khawaja slams commitment critics after being fit for Adelaide TestUsman Khawaja has hit out at his critics who questioned his commitment while playing for Australia ahead of the Adelaide Test. Khawaja also said that he is ready to go for the third Test against England.

Indian football body distances itself from Lionel Messi GOAT tour chaos in KolkataA day meant to celebrate football ended in chaos as Lionel Messi's brief Kolkata appearance sparked fan anger, exposed poor planning and forced the AIFF to publicly distance itself from the event.

Delhi Capitals new recruit fires Hobart Hurricanes to maiden WBBL titleLizelle Lee's explosive 77 off 44 balls powered Hobart Hurricanes to their maiden WBBL title with an eight-wicket win over Perth Scorchers in the final on Saturday at the Bellerive Oval.

Exclusive: Messi talks India, culture and World Cup glory with Sanjiv GoenkaBefore the crowds arrived, Lionel Messi spent his first morning in India with Sanjiv Goenka — a private Kolkata conversation that set a reflective tone and offered a rare glimpse into the man behind football's most celebrated name.

PCB unhappy as ICC omits Pakistan captain Agha from T20 World Cup ticket posterThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has expressed its dissatisfaction with the International Cricket Council for omitting Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha from the promotional poster for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 ticket sales.

Abhishek Sharma on cusp of Virat Kohli's historic 8-year-old T20 recordAbhishek Sharma is closing in on Virat Kohli's T20 calendar-year run record, having scored 1,533 runs in 39 matches, while India's T20I series against South Africa remains evenly poised at 1‑1.

Messy start to Messi's India tour: VIPs get darshan, fans feel cheatedLionel Messi's Kolkata visit, intended as a celebratory start to his India tour, descended into chaos as poor crowd management, VVIP congestion, and a rushed exit left fans frustrated, organiser detained, and the Chief Minister issuing an apology.

Will Kohli meet Messi in Mumbai during GOAT tour? Here's what we knowVirat Kohli has returned to India along with wife Anushka Sharma amid Lionel Messi's Goat India tour. Fans are speculating that India batter is set to meet Messi in Mumbai.

Messi's India tour organiser arrested in Kolkata over mismanagementLionel Messi's India tour began with chaos in Kolkata after crowd unrest overshadowed celebrations. The arrest of organiser Satadru Dutta shifted focus from spectacle to accountability and investigations.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
